Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision is valid when considering an internal flight alternative (IFA) without prior notice
Evidence_Type: Evidence that applicant’s parents safely relocated within Colombia
Basis_of_Claim: Claimant challenged lack of notice and inadequate reasoning on IFA
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant was informed of IFA at the start of the hearing and had opportunity to respond
Application_Error: Alleged lack of prior notice on IFA
Legal_Standard: Principles of natural justice, procedural fairness
Application_Factor: Opportunity to address IFA during hearing
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of notice and reasonableness of relocation
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Natural justice requires notice of issues but not formal pre-hearing notice if opportunity to respond exists
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to prove unreasonableness of internal flight alternative
Procedural_Fairness: Sufficient notice provided at hearing start
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Lack of notice and inadequate reasoning on IFA

Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Whether failure to provide prior notice of IFA violates natural justice
Assessment_Factor: Safety and reasonableness of internal flight alternative
Procedural_Requirement: Notice of IFA issue during hearing
Basis_for_Decision: Existence of viable internal flight alternative
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Perceived availability of safe relocation within country of origin
Evidence_Type: Evidence of family member relocation within Colombia
Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Failure to establish risk if returned to original location with possibility of internal relocation
Procedural_Issue: Timing and adequacy of notice on IFA
Legal_Issue: Whether Board violated natural justice by failing to give prior notice of IFA
Relevant_Factors_Considered: Family members’ safe relocation within Colombia

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to provide adequate notice in refugee claims
Legal_Issue: Whether formal pre-hearing notice of IFA is required under principles of natural justice
Application_Facts: Applicant was informed of IFA at the beginning of the hearing
Remedy_Requested: Overturn of Board’s decision based on procedural unfairness
Court_Ruling: No formal pre-hearing notice required if opportunity to respond is given
Defendant_Behavior: Board raised IFA issue at hearing start without prior written notice
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness due to insufficient notice
Legal_Standard: Natural justice, right to be heard
Assessment_Factor: Opportunity to respond to IFA issue during hearing
Procedural_Issue: Timing and method of raising IFA as an issue
Evidence_Used: Relocation of applicant’s parents within Colombia
Relief_Sought: Certification of legal question or reversal of decision
Governing_Rule: Notice must be given but not necessarily before hearing
Harm_Assessment: No prejudice shown due to opportunity to respond
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged lack of explicit notice and reasoning on IFA reasonableness
Jurisdictional_Issue: Domestic application of international refugee law
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence supported existence of viable IFA
Decision_Rationale: Applicant had sufficient opportunity to address IFA; relocation found reasonable
